byline.contributor: Mauricio Lima contributed reporting from Surt, Libya.

abstract: Libyan forces fighting vestiges of Col Muammar el-Qaddafi’s toppled government say anti-Qaddafi fighters are in complete control of Bani Walid, loyalist desert enclave south of capital Tripoli, but have yet to proclaim total victory in his Mediterranean hometown of Surt.
snippet: If a report from the anti-Qaddafi fighters about taking control of Bani Walid proves accurate, only a small district of Surt will remain as a stronghold for loyalists.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )

lead_paragraph: If a report from the anti-Qaddafi fighters about taking control of Bani Walid proves accurate, only a small district of Surt will remain as a stronghold for loyalists.

headline.main: Pro-Qaddafi Enclave in Desert Is Said to Fall After a Battle
headline.print_headline: Pro-Qaddafi Enclave in Desert Is Said to Fall After a Battle
headline.seo: Bani Walid Seized, Anti-Qaddafi Fighters Say
